article.title: Foreign_relations_of_the_Czech_Republic

link.target: File:Diplomatic missions of the Czech Republic.png
link.part: Embassies (not consulates) of the Czech Republic in the world.

article.paragraph: The Czech Republic entertains diplomatic relations with 191 countries in the world, around half of which maintain a residentembassyin the Czech capital city, Prague.http://www.mzv.cz/file/955338/The_Czech_Republic_s_Foreign_Policy_in_2011___A_Brief_Overview.pdfThe Czech Republic is a full member of theUnited Nations(and all of its main specialized agencies and boards), of theEuropean Union, and ofNATO.

Until theVelvet Revolutionof 1989, the foreign policy ofCzechoslovakiahad followed that of theSoviet Union. Since the revolution and the subsequent mutually-agreedDissolution of Czechoslovakiapeaceful dissolutionof Czechoslovakia into theCzech RepublicandSlovakia, theCzechshave made integration with Western institutions their chief foreign policy objective. This goal was rapidly met with great success, as the nation joinedNATOin 1999 and the European Union in 2004, and held thePresidency of the Council of the European UnionPresidency of the European Unionduring the first half of 2009.
article.heading: Participation in international organizations
article.paragraph: The Czech Republic participates in theUnited Nations(UN);World Trade Organization(WTO);International Monetary Fund(IMF);Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development(OECD);International Energy Agency(IEA); North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) and theInternational Whaling Commission.
The Czech Republic is a member of the United Nations and participates in its specialized agencies. It is a member of theGeneral Agreement on Tariffs and Trade.

The Czech Republic became a member of the EU in May 2004. This followed signature of the Treaty of Accession with nine other candidate nations in 1993. Although there have been disagreements with established EU member nations over some economic issues, such as agricultural quotas and a recentWhenNovember 2010amendment to the gaming law, relations are good.

The Czech Republic became a member of the North Atlantic Treaty Organisation, along with Poland and Hungary, on 12 March 1999. This membership represents a milestone in the country's foreign policy and security orientation.
article.heading: International disputes
Liechtenstein
article.paragraph: Throughout the past decades, Liechtenstein continuously claimed restitution forconvert1600km2on(which is ten times the size of Liechtenstein) of land currently located in the Czech Republic that were confiscated from the Liechtenstein family in 1918 by the then newly established state of Czechoslovakia; the Czech Republic insisted that it could not acknowledge or be responsible for claims going back to before February 1948, when the Communists had seized power.
As a result, Liechtenstein did not diplomatically recognize the existence of the Czech Republic as a new state (and, for that matter, also that of the Slovak Republic) until 2009.

In July 2009, the Prince of Liechtenstein announced he was resigning to the previous unsuccessful claims to property located in the Czech Republic, and on 13 July 2009, after politically recognizing one another, the Czech Republic and Liechtenstein formally established diplomatic relations.cite webLiechtenstein and the Czech Republic establish diplomatic relationshttp://88.82.102.51/fileadmin/_pm.liechtenstein.li/en/090713_PM_Beziehungen_CzFl_en.pdfPDFGovernment Spokesperson's Office, the Principality of Liechtenstein13 July 20096 August 2009cite webNavázání diplomatických styků České republiky s Knížectvím Lichtenštejnskohttp://www.mzv.cz/jnp/cz/udalosti_a_media/prohlaseni_a_stanoviska/x2009_07_13_lilchtejnstejnsko_navazani_diplomatickych_vztahu.html[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Czech Republic)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Czech Republic]]Czech13 July 200913 July 2009http://web.archive.org/web/20091213011215/http://www.mzv.cz/jnp/cz/udalosti_a_media/prohlaseni_a_stanoviska/x2009_07_13_lilchtejnstejnsko_navazani_diplomatickych_vztahu.html13 December 2009
article.heading: Placement of US National Missile Defense base
article.paragraph: In February 2007, the US started formal negotiations with Czech Republic and Poland concerning construction of missile shield installations in those countries for a Ground-Based Midcourse Defense System.Cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/6704669.stmEurope diary: Missile defenceBBC News31 May 2007MarkMardellMark MardellGovernment of the Czech Republic agrees (while 67% Czechs disagree and only about 22% support it)Cite press releasehttp://www.cvvm.cas.cz/upl/zpravy/100761s_pm80306.pdfCitizens on U.S. Anti-Missile Radar Base in Czech RepublicObčané o americké radarové základně v ČRPDFCzechCentrum pro výzkum veřejného mínění6 March 2008to host a missile defense radar on its territory while a base of missile interceptors is supposed to be built in Poland. The objective is reportedly to protect another parts of US National Missile Defense from long-range missile strikes from Iran and North Korea, but Czech PMMirek Topolneksaid the main reason is to avoid Russian influence and strengthen ties to US.cite webhttp://www.ods.cz/akce/kongresy/18.kongres/projev.php?IDhttp://web.archive.org/web/20080531075236/http://www.ods.cz/akce/kongresy/18.kongres/projev.php?ID31 May 2008[[Civic Democratic Party (Czech Republic)|Civic Democratic Party]]MirekTopolánekMirek Topolánek18. Kongres ODS: Úvodní projev předsedy ODS24 November 2007

The main government supporterAlexandr Vondra, Deputy Prime Minister for European affairs, used to be an ambassador to the USA. More problematic is that between 2004 and 2006 he was an executive director of a lobbying company Dutko Worldwide Prague. Dutko's and its strategic partner AMI Communications (PR company) customers are Boeing, Lockheed Martin, Nortrop Grumman, which are largest contractors for NMD development.cite webhttp://www.nenasili.cz/cs/2026_kdo-prosazuje-radar-v-crKdo prosazuje radar v ČR?Hnutí Nenásilí16 October 2008Czechcite webhttp://www.greenpeace.org/czech/protiraketova-obrana/protiraketova_lobbyProtiraketová lobby v USA a České republice[[Greenpeace]]CzechAMI Communications also received (without a formal selection procedure) a government contract to persuade Czechs to support US radar base.
article.heading: Europe

tablecell.paragraph: SeeAlbaniaCzech Republic relationsThe multi-national Communist armed forces sole joint action was theWarsaw Pact invasion of Czechoslovakiain August 1968. All member countries, with the exception of thePeople's Republic of Albaniaand the Socialist Republic of Romania participated in the invasion. Albania formally withdrew from theWarsaw Pactin 1968 over the matter.cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/onthisday/hi/dates/stories/may/14/newsid_3771000/3771065.stmBBC News1955: Communist states sign Warsaw Pact14 May 195527 May 2010

list.listitem: Albania has an embassy inPrague.
Czech Republic has an embassy inTirana.

tablecell.paragraph: Austria has an embassy inPragueand two honorary consulates (inBrnoandesk Budjovice). The Czech Republic has an embassy inViennaand five honorary consulates (inGraz,Innsbruck,Klagenfurt,Linz, andSalzburg).Both countries are full members of the European Union. They shareconvert362kmonof common border, which can be crossed anywhere without border control due to theSchengen Agreement.

tablerow.tablecell: SeeForeign relations of Bosnia and Herzegovina

tablecell.paragraph: Diplomatic relations between Bulgaria and Czechoslovakia were established on 27 September 1920, they were severed on 1 June 1939 and were restored on 10 October 1945. On 23 December 1992 Bulgaria recognised the Czech Republic and established diplomatic relations with it at the level of embassies as of 1 January 1993. Bulgaria has an embassy and an honorary consulate in Prague.cite webhttp://www.mzv.cz/jnp/en/diplomatic_missions/foreign_missions_to_the_czech_republic/bulgaria_embassy_of_the_republic_of.htmlBulgaria - Embassy of the Republic of Bulgaria20 February 2015Czech Republic has an embassy inSofiaand an honorary consulate inVarna.cite webhttp://www.mzv.cz/sofiaCzech Republic embassy in SofiaMzv.cz30 December 200714 April 2011

Denmark has an embassy in Prague.cite webhttp://www.ambprag.um.dk/en/Danish embassy in PragueAmbprag.um.dk14 January 200814 April 2011
Both countries are full members of NATO and of the European Union.
Both countries restored their diplomatic relation on 9 September 1991. On 1 January 1993 diplomatic relations were automatically transferred to the successor states of Czechoslovakia.
Czech Republic has an embassy and an honorary consulate inTallinn.cite webhttp://www.mzv.cz/wwwo/default.asp?idjCzech embassy in TallinnMzv.cz30 April 201014 April 2011
Estonia has an embassy in Prague.cite webhttp://www.estemb.cz/Estonian embassy in PragueEstemb.cz14 April 2011
Both countries are full members of NATO and of the European Union.

list.listitem: The first diplomatic contacts date back from theMiddle Ages. France has been the first country to recognize Czechoslovakia on 28 October 1918.
The two countries concluded a treaty of Alliance on 25 January 1924.Text inLeague of Nations Treaty Series, vol. 23, pp. 164169.

The Czech Republic has an embassy in Paris and four honorary consulates (inLille,Lyon,Nancy, FranceNancy, andNantes).cite webhttp://www.mzv.cz/wwwo/?zuCzech embassy in Paris (in Czech and French only)Mzv.cz30 April 201014 April 2011

Both countries are full members of NATO and of the European Union. Since 1999, Czech Republic is an observer in theFrancophonie.

tablecell.paragraph: The present day relations between the two countries are at their best, and many agreements have been signed. Russia also has further reduced its oil deliveries to the Czech Republic. The Czech Republic has an embassy in Moscow, and two consulate generals (inSaint PetersburgandYekaterinburg). The Russian Federation has anEmbassy of Russia in Pragueembassy in Prague, and two consulate generals in (Brno andKarlovy Vary).

Czech relations with Serbia were usually positive, just like relations between Czechoslovakia andYugoslavia(prewar). However, Czech government under administration of Mirek Topolnek decided to recognize Kosovo the very important issue in Serbian politics.

article.paragraph: mainCzech Republic–Mexico relationsDiplomatic relations between Czechoslovakia and Mexico were established in 1922. Mexico re-recognised Czech independence in 1993 after its separation with Slovakia.

tablecell.paragraph: The government of Czechoslovakia recognised independence of Israel 5 days after its declaration on 19 May 1948. Diplomatic relations between both countries were established on 3 July 1948. CzechoslovakiaArms shipments from Czechoslovakia to Israel 19471949supported with military aircraft and weaponsDeclaration of Independence (Israel)newly createdIsraeli state for several months, however then-new communist government ceased this support and in few years even the diplomatic relations were broken. Communist regime did spread anti-Israelipropaganda, like all then socialist countries. After theVelvet revolution, the relations were renewed. The Czech Republic has an embassy inTel Avivand 4 honorary consulates (inEilat,Haifa,JerusalemandRamat Gan).cite webhttp://www.mzv.cz/telaviv/en/index.htmlCzech embassy in Tel AvivMzv.cz14 April 2011Israel has an embassy in Prague.Israeli embassy in Prague

In December 2008 the Czech Air Force wanted to train in desert conditions for the upcoming mission in Afghanistan. No country agreed to help, except Israel. Israel saw it as an opportunity to thank the Czechs for training Israeli pilots when the country was first established.cite webhttp://www.ceskenoviny.cz/news/index_view.php?idCzech pilots train in Israel for Afghan missionCeskenoviny.cz14 April 2011
There are 3,000 Jews living in the Czech Republic (see alsoHistory of the Jews in the Czech Republic).

The Embassy of the Czech Republic in Ulaanbaatar was formally reopened in 1999.Cite journalReport on the Foreign Policy of the Czech Republic, 1998–1999[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Czech Republic)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Czech Republic]]199924 October 2007PDFhttp://pdc.ceu.hu/archive/00002565/01/Report_on_the_Foreign_Policy_of_the_Czech_Republic_1998.pdf187–188

The current diplomatic relationship of the Czech Republic and the Philippines has its roots to the friendship of Filipino national heroJos RizalandFerdinand Blumentritteven neither countries existed yet back in the 19th century. Rizal visited Blumentritt in the city of Litomerice, Bohemia (present day Czech Republic) in 1887. According to Filipino Foreign secretary Albert del Rosario, the friendship between the two men served as the foundation of the current bilateral ties between the two countries.
Czech Republic has an embassy in Manila.
Philippines has an embassy in Prague.
The Czech Republic has an embassy inIslamabadand two honorary consulates inLahoreandKarachi.cite webhttp://www.mzv.cz/islamabad/en/index.htmlCzech embassy in IslamabadMzv.cz14 April 2011

Pakistan has an embassy in Prague.cite webhttp://www.czechembassy.org/wwwo/mzv/default.asp?idCzech Ministry of Foreign Affairs: direction of the Pakistani embassy in PragueCzechembassy.org30 April 201014 April 2011

On 20 September 2008 the Czech Republic's ambassador to Pakistan,Ivo rek, was killed in a deadly blast at the Marriott Hotel in Islamabad.Cite newshttp://edition.cnn.com/2008/WORLD/asiapcf/09/21/pakistan.islamabad.marriott.blast/index.htmlCzech ambassador confirmed dead in blastCNN21 September 200814 April 2011

article.heading: Rest of world
